prior_knowledge_digest: Students should have a basic understanding of language learning and be familiar with the concept of grammar. They should know what nouns and verbs are in English, as this will help them grasp similar concepts in Latin. Familiarity with the Roman alphabet is also beneficial, as it is the basis for Latin script.
misconception_watchlist: Assuming Latin word order is the same as English

primary: Introduce the Latin alphabet and pronunciation
Learn basic Latin greetings and farewells

lesson_flow.description: Begin with a warm welcome and introduce the day's objectives.
lesson_flow.student_action: Listen and engage with the teacher's introduction.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Set a positive tone for the start of the Latin journey.

lesson_flow.description: Introduce the Latin alphabet and its pronunciation.
lesson_flow.student_action: Repeat after the teacher and practice pronunciation.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Use audio clips to reinforce correct pronunciation.

lesson_flow.description: Practice basic Latin greetings and farewells using flashcards.
lesson_flow.student_action: Participate in choral repetition and pair practice.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Encourage students to use gestures to reinforce meaning.

lesson_flow.description: Students practice writing the Latin alphabet and simple phrases.
lesson_flow.student_action: Write the alphabet and greetings in their notebooks.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Circulate to provide feedback and correct any errors.

lesson_flow.description: Review the day's learning and preview the next lesson.
lesson_flow.student_action: Reflect on what they learned and ask questions.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Highlight the importance of consistent practice.
